articles.title: Zimbabwean breakout at T20 World Cup has fans rejoicing renaissance
articles.description: Swelling fanbase has been in dreamland this past month as Zimbabwe have defied all expectations in the competition

articles.title: Live Talk: The Connection
articles.description: Livetalk is a 30-minute call-in TV (simulcast) talk show engaging Zimbabweans in-country and in the diaspora to air their views on developments taking place in Zimbabwe and elsewhere. The program aims to enlighten citizens on critical issues by engaging experts, non-state actors, politicians and government officials. Join us Monday to Friday 1800-1830UTC, 2000-2030pm Zimbabwe time.

articles.title: South African army men recover two vehicles being smuggled in flooded Limpopo River into Zimbabwe
articles.description: Thupeyo Muleya South African National Defence Force members deployed to patrol the border with Zimbabwe have recovered a Toyota Land Cruiser worth around R1,5 million that was being smuggled out...The post South African army men recover two vehicles being smuggled in flooded Limpopo River into Zimbabwe appeared first on herald.

more.title: How the Skeleton of Mutapa Times is Based on Sarah Charlesworth's Work
more.description: Conceptual artist Sarah Charlesworth's 1979 study of how newspapers covered a solar eclipse inspired the framework behind The Mutapa Times.

more.title: SA fast food chain makes Zim bow
more.description: Source: SA fast food chain makes Zim bow -Newsday Zimbabwe South African fast-food chain Pedros Flame Grilled Chicken is set to create about 300 jobs in Zimbabwe as it rolls out an initial 10 outlets by February next year.The brand, founded in *2018* and now operating more than 210 stores across South Africa, Zambia, Botswana [...]The post SA fast food chain makes Zim bow appeared first on Zimbabwe Situation.

more.title: Citizens push back on Mnangagwa’s term extension
more.description: Source: Citizens push back on Mnangagwa’s term extension -Newsday Zimbabwe Sanyati residents have urged their Member of Parliament, Polite Kambamura, not to support proposed constitutional amendments that would extend President Emmerson Mnangagwa’s tenure by two years, keeping him in office until 2030. The Constitutional Amendment Bill No 3, gazetted last week, gives Parliament the power [...]The post Citizens push back on Mnangagwa’s term extension appeared first on Zimbabwe Situation.

more.title: Govt, Pfizer sign landmark health equity Accord
more.description: Source: Govt, Pfizer sign landmark health equity Accord – herald Trust Freddy Herald Correspondent GOVERNMENT has formally signed onto the Pfizer Accord for a Healthier World, a high-level agreement designed to provide the nation with equitable access to patented medicines and vaccines on a not-for-profit basis. Health and Child Care Minister Dr Douglas Mombeshora yesterday [...]The post Govt, Pfizer sign landmark health equity Accord appeared first on Zimbabwe Situation.

more.title: Polarization is part of any democracy and can never justify extending presidential terms
more.description: Source: Polarization is part of any democracy and can never justify extending presidential terms When those in power place their own failures on a constitution. Tendai Ruben Mbofana ​The current discourse surrounding the proposed Constitutional Amendment No 3 Bill in Zimbabwe represents a profound misunderstanding of democratic principles or, more likely, a deliberate attempt to [...]The post Polarization is part of any democracy and can never justify extending presidential terms appeared first on Zimbabwe Situation.

more.title: Professor Moyo and the deception of disguising a term extension as an election cycle
more.description: Source: Professor Moyo and the deception of disguising a term extension as an election cycle The deception seems to have no end. Tendai Ruben Mbofana ​In a recent and carefully worded statement, Professor Jonathan Moyo attempted to provide a scholarly veneer to what is, in reality, a blunt instrument for power retention. If you value [...]The post Professor Moyo and the deception of disguising a term extension as an election cycle appeared first on Zimbabwe Situation.

more.title: Zimbabwe Vigil Diary 21st February 2026
more.description: Source: Zimbabwe Vigil Diary 21st February 2026 Once again Vigil activists met outside the Zimbabwe Embassy in London to continue our protest against the human rights abuse and lack of democracy in Zimbabwe perpetrated by ZANU PF, the ruling regime. https://www.flickr.com/photos/zimbabwevigil/55112630549/sizes/m/ Thanks to those who came today: Elizabeth Chitenga, Munashe Madziyauswa, Chantelle Manyande, Philip Maponga, Samantha [...]The post Zimbabwe Vigil Diary 21st February 2026 appeared first on Zimbabwe Situation.

more.title: Politburo meets today
more.description: Source: Politburo meets today – herald Joseph Madzimure Zimpapers Politics Hub ZANU PF will convene a crucial Politburo meeting today, party spokesperson, Ambassador Christopher Mutsvangwa, has said. In a statement, Ambassador Mutsvangwa said: “The Secretary General, Advocate Jacob Mudenda, advises members of the Politburo meeting to be held this Wednesday, February 25, 2026, at 10:00 [...]The post Politburo meets today appeared first on Zimbabwe Situation.

more.title: What happens if the next term is extended to 20 years – asks Coltart, as headstrong Zanu PF trudges on with Constitutional amendments
more.description: WITH Zanu PF leaders and government adamant that President Emmerson Mnangagwa’s second five-year-term must be extended by two more years, Bulawayo mayor David Coltart has asked how Zimbabweans would react if government was to add another 20-year-term in 2030.The post What happens if the next term is extended to 20 years – asks Coltart, as headstrong Zanu PF trudges on with Constitutional amendments appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.title: Not a fluke says ZANU PF legislator as Parliament hails Chevrons performance at T20 World Cup
more.description: Parliament has hailed the exploits of the Zimbabwe senior men’s cricket team at the ongoing T20 World Cup, being hosted by Sri Lanka and India. Zimbabwe has earned global admiration after putting in strong performances to qualify unbeaten for the Super 8 stage. On their way to the Super 8s, the Chevrons beat Australia, Oman, [...]The post Not a fluke says ZANU PF legislator as Parliament hails Chevrons performance at T20 World Cup appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.title: South African musician Naledi Aphiwe apologises after Xenophobic remark against Zimbabweans resurfaces
more.description: Not willing to risk facing the wrath of Zimbabweans when she comes to perform in the country in April, South African musician Naledi Aphiwe has apologised over a xenophobic remark she made online a few years ago. Naledi Aphiwe’s announcement as part of the line-up to perform at the Ama2k festival, to be held in [...]The post South African musician Naledi Aphiwe apologises after Xenophobic remark against Zimbabweans resurfaces appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.title: ZIMRA wins Supreme Court appeal against Pacific Cigarette Company
more.description: The Zimbabwe Revenue Authority (ZIMRA) has won a major Supreme Court appeal against Pacific Cigarette Company (Private) Limited after the court ruled that the company was not entitled to a tax clearance certificate (TCC) while owing more than US$19.5 million in taxes and operating under corporate rescue. In a unanimous judgment delivered in Harare on [...]The post ZIMRA wins Supreme Court appeal against Pacific Cigarette Company appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.
